Author: rms
Content: Take the free shuttle from Palo Alto to Stanford though! Stanford owns a decadent amount of land between the too, it was a much longer walk than I expected.

Author: utnick
Content:
My predictions:

buffer overflows will no longer exist because anything user input facing will be written in 'safe' languages

sql injection/cross site scripting will be no more as frameworks continue to prevent them out of the box

somebody will create a user friendly sandboxing system rendering trojans and spywhere obsolete

Author: jgrahamc
Content: Better yet.  Park the car and _walk_ down University Avenue.

Author: Poleris
Content:
Here's an honest question. Why isn't more research being done into solving Poker compared to the amount put into Go or Chess?

\n> It seems to me that it is an interesting question that combines elements of computation, AI, and psychology.

> One can see instant practical results by playing your bot for real money.

> Poker is a fun game. :)

\nAny answers would be appreciated, especially as I'm thinking about doing a PhD and am currently exploring open problem domains.

Author: vegashacker
Content: You know, like, "I was playing 30-60 at the Bellagio, and I got cleaned out..."  Something along those lines.
